meanings.definition: The use of magic, especially black magic.
meanings.sent1: Legends tell of the sorcery used by the old witch to curse the village.
meanings.sent2: In the fantasy book, the evil sorcerer practiced dark sorcery to control minds.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the idea of using sorcery to make their toys come alive.
meanings.sent4: Her words held a kind of sorcery, enchanting all who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The magician's hands moved with swift sorcery, creating illusions that amazed the audience.

meanings.definition: The practice of casting spells or performing rituals to achieve supernatural results.
meanings.sent1: The sorcery of the ancient priestesses was said to bring rain to the dry lands.
meanings.sent2: In the enchanted forest, the fairies were known for their powerful sorcery.
meanings.sent3: The sorcery of baking cookies always made the children smile.
meanings.sent4: Her dance had a sorcery that captivated all who watched.
meanings.sent5: The sorcery of friendship can mend even the deepest wounds.
